message: The xml:id of the TEI element should be equal to the name of the file, without the file extension. Currently the value of xml:id is "step_A_171117" whilst the file name is "step_A_171117.xml"
TEI/@type should be either "researchScenario" or "researchStep". The current value of TEI/@type is "researchStep"

test: tei:date and tei:persName and tei:affiliation and tei:desc
message: When recording a revision, some precise metadata must be given : the date of the revision, the name of the responsibe and his/her affiliation and a description.
The title is too short: 10 characters minimum
The title of a step should describe the action to perform, starting or ending with a gerund (or an infinitive), or a noun .

nodeText:
If the document contains sensitive or personal data, it
      may be necessary to make them not public available and therefore anonymize them.The point is
      to do that without reducing the usefulness of data (need of thinking what should be the
      scale/scope of the anonymization). Firstly, it has to be noticed that pre-planning and
      agreeing with participants before collecting data or during the consent process, on what may
      and may not be recorded or transcribed, can be a much more effective way of handling sensitive
      data and easier than spending time later removing it from a recording or transcript. Do the
      anonymization on file copies: use repositionable tapes for paper documents and XML markers for
      digital documents.
